name: Amber Rod

attributes.Augments: Strong Ice Wave -> +6% Critical Extra Damage

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Cobra Rod
notes:
Notes
It has permanent Life Leech that leeches more than Intricate Vampirism but less than Powerful Vampirism. Due to that, it cannot be imbued with Vampirism. It's one of the best Rods available, rivaling with the Falcon Rod which has one additional Magic Level bonus but no Life Leech (and also 2 Imbuing slots).

name: Deepling Ceremonial Dagger
notes:
Notes
Among the most powerful weapons available for a sub-200 mage, comparable to the Energized Limb (which does higher damage but has shorter range). Both Druids and sorcerers can use this weapon and (alongside it's upgrade, the Deepling Fork).
It is impossible to imbue this item with critical hit imbuements.

name: Deepling Fork
notes:
Notes
An upgrade of sorts from the Deepling Ceremonial Dagger. It's one of the few weapons that come with a Critical hit chance out of the box (It's also impossible to imbue it with additional critical hit chance).

name: Draining Inferniarch Rod
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using an Inferniarch Rod.
None of the Draining Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Vampirism.

name: Dream Blossom Staff
notes:
Notes
It is notable for being one of the few magical weapons usable by both sorcerers and druids. For a sorcerer, it is an straight downgrade from Wand of Defiance, compared to which it deals less damage per shot but has otherwise identical stats (save for the two imbuement slots). For a druid, it is a rather valuable weapon though, as it deals energy damage which they otherwise have a very limited access to. It has two imbuement slots, but it cannot be imbued with Critical Hit, only Mana Leech, Hit Points Leech and Magic Level. Provides 4 sqm of blue light.

name: Eldritch Rod
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Energized Limb
notes:
Notes
Among the most powerful weapons available for a sub-200 mage, comparable to the Deepling Ceremonial Dagger (which does less damage but has longer range). Both Druids and Sorcerers can use this weapon and it's the only fire based rod available for the former.
It is not possible to imbue this item with critical hit imbuements.

name: Falcon Rod
notes:
Notes
It's one of the few Rods that may be imbued with Critical Hit Imbuements (Basic, Intricate and Powerful Strike).

name: Gilded Eldritch Rod
notes:
Notes
It works just like a standard Eldritch Rod.

name: Glacial Rod
notes:
Notes
It is the druid's equivalent of the sorcerer's Wand of Everblazing and the ice damage counterpart to the Muck Rod. A very powerful rod commonly used by mid to high level druids and a direct upgrade from the Hailstorm Rod. It has a longer attack range than any of the lower-levelled rods and also increases the wielder's magic level by 1. Together with the Muck Rod it was the best weapon for a druid until the introduction of the Dream Blossom Staff, which deals less damage per shot, but has 2 imbuement slots and, at the time of implementation, had a higher magic level bonus and a longer attack range.

name: Grand Sanguine Rod

attributes.Augments: Eternal Winter -> +6% base damage, Terra Wave -> +8% base damage
attributes.Attributes: magic level +5, ice magic level +1, earth magic level +1

notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet dropped by Bakragore when fighting him under the influence of Bakragore's Burden.

name: Hailstorm Rod
notes:
Notes
An upgrade from the Terra Rod and the druid's equivalent of the sorcerer's Wand of Inferno. It is the ice damage counterpart to the Springsprout Rod and the Underworld Rod. Hailstorm Rods replaced  Tempest Rods in the Winter Update 2007, which in turn replaced  Elven Wands in the Winter Update 2005.
Needed for Mage Outfits Quest (male) and Summoner Outfits Quest (female).

name: Inferniarch Rod
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be used in the Doomforge to be turned into either a Siphoning Inferniarch Rod, Rending Inferniarch Rod, or Draining Inferniarch Rod.

name: Jungle Rod
notes:
Notes
This rod can be imbued with Basic Strike and Intricate Strike imbuements.It's part of the Jungle Set.

name: Lion Rod
notes:
Notes
This item cannot be imbued with Strike Imbuements.

name: Moonlight Rod
notes:
Notes
An upgrade from the Snakebite Rod and the second weakest rod available on the mainland. It is the druid's equivalent of the sorcerer's Wand of Dragonbreath. Moonlight Rods replaced  Conjurer Wands in the Winter Update 2005. They used to deal energy damage, but the magic reform in the Winter Update 2007 changed their type of damage dealt to ice.
Needed for Mage Outfits Quest (male) and Summoner Outfits Quest (female).

name: Muck Rod
notes:
Notes
It is the druid's equivalent of the sorcerer's Wand of Defiance and the earth damage counterpart to the Glacial Rod. A very powerful rod commonly used by mid to high level druids and a direct upgrade from the Springsprout Rod. It has a longer attack range than any of the lower-levelled rods and also increases the wielder's magic level by 1. Together with the Glacial Rod it was the best weapon for a druid until the introduction of the Dream Blossom Staff, which deals less damage per shot, but has 2 imbuement slots and, at the time of implementation, had a higher magic level bonus and a longer attack range.

name: Naga Rod
notes:
Notes
It's part of the Naga Set.

name: Necrotic Rod
notes:
Notes
An upgrade from the Moonlight Rod and the druid's equivalent of the sorcerer's Wand of Decay. However, many druids prefer to wait until they can use the Northwind Rod, since ice is generally a more useful element than death. Necrotic Rods replaced  Volcanic Rods in the Winter Update 2007.
Needed for Mage Outfits Quest (male) and Summoner Outfits Quest (female).

name: Northwind Rod
notes:
Notes
The druid's equivalent of the sorcerer's Wand of Draconia and the ice damage counterpart to the Necrotic Rod, which typically makes it more valuable, as ice is generally a more useful element than death. It's the lowest level rod which can be imbued (critical imbuement not possible)

name: Ogre Scepta
notes:
Notes
It can be sold to NPC Mugruu after finishing Vuzrog's questline. Its price tends to be low by It is identical in properties to a Springsprout Rod, but with the exception that it weighs 2 oz more.
Can be obtained from Shaggy Ogre Bags.

name: Rending Inferniarch Rod
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using an Inferniarch Rod.
None of the Rending Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Strike.

name: Rod of Destruction
notes:
Notes
Yana will trade you one for 50 Gold Tokens. It is one of the few rods that may be imbued with Critical Hit imbuements (Basic, Intricate and Powerful Strike).

name: Sanguine Rod

attributes.Augments: Eternal Winter -> +3% base damage, Terra Wave -> +4% base damage
attributes.Attributes: magic level +5, ice magic level +1, earth magic level +1

notes:
Notes
It is part of the Sanguine Set. This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Covet, which can be looted from any boss in the 4 areas of the Rotten Blood Quest if some conditions are met. Can also be obtained through a Crimson Offering.

name: Shimmer Rod
notes:
Notes
Seems to have similar power to Hailstorm Rod with higher level requirement due to 1 sqm longer range, which makes it a better choice for hunting with. This item lasts for a total of 7 days.

Can be obtained by transforming Shimmer Swimmer using it on Yielowax. Upon creating one, you will receive the following message: Waxing the surprisingly dry scales of the shimmer swimmer with the strange yielowax suddenly transforms him into a rod!

name: Siphoning Inferniarch Rod
notes:
Notes
Part of the Inferniarch Set, can be obtained via the Doomforge by using an Inferniarch Rod.
None of the Siphoning Inferniarch weapons can be imbued with Basic, Intricate, or Powerful Void.

name: Snakebite Rod
notes:
Notes
The druid's equivalent of the sorcerer's Wand of Vortex and the lowest-levelled rod available on the mainland. A rather ineffective weapon, as a lot of monsters, even the weakest, are resistant or outright immune to earth damage. Snakebite Rods replaced  Golden Wands in the Winter Update 2005.
Needed for Mage Outfits Quest(male) and Summoner Outfits Quest(female).

name: Sorcerer and Druid Staff
notes:
Notes
It looks the same as a Wand of Vortex and Xodet's First Wand.

name: Soulhexer
notes:
Notes
This wand can be imbued with Strike Imbuements. It's part of the Soul Set and currently the best Rod in the game.
It is a possible reward of the Soul War Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Soul Set the first time said quest is completed.
This item is not dropped by any creatures or bosses but it can be obtained from a Bag You Desire, which can be looted from any enemy or boss in the 5 areas of the Soul War Quest if some conditions are met.

name: Springsprout Rod
notes:
Notes
The druid's equivalent of the sorcerer's Wand of Starstorm and the earth damage counterpart to the Hailstorm Rod and the Underworld Rod.

name: Terra Rod
notes:
Notes
An upgrade from the Necrotic Rod and the Northwind Rod, that, however, does not makes them both obsolete, since earth is widely considered to be the worst element, as a lot of monsters are immune to it. It is the druid's equivalent of the sorcerer's Wand of Cosmic Energy. Terra Rods replaced Quagmire Rods in the Winter Update 2007, which in turn replaced  Wooden Wands in the Winter Update 2005.
Needed for Mage Outfits Quest (male) and Summoner Outfits Quest (female).

name: The Chiller
notes:
Notes
The weakest of all rods. You receive it to practice the Druid vocation on Dawnport. You cannot take it with yourself to the Mainland, however some people still own multiple copies there from exploiting the bugs in the beginning of Dawnport existence.

name: Underworld Rod
notes:
Notes
The druid's equivalent of the sorcerer's Wand of Voodoo and the death damage counterpart to the Hailstorm Rod and the Springsprout Rod.
